critiques.subject: Husky dog standing on a sandy beach looking toward the ocean horizon
improvements: [SUBTLE] Increase clarity and dehaze on the sky
[SUBTLE] Crop slightly from the bottom right
preserve: The warm golden-hour sunlight hitting the sand and the dog
The smooth blue gradient of the sky
critiques.notes: A peaceful capture with lovely lighting conditions. The primary issue is the tilted horizon, which is a quick fix. Post-processing should focus on drawing the eye to the dog by recovering shadow detail and slightly refining the composition.

improvements_detailed.reason: The water line is noticeably tilted downwards to the right, which distracts from the composition's stability
The dog's dark fur obscures facial details; brightening shadows will reveal features while maintaining contrast

improvements_detailed.action: Increase clarity and dehaze on the sky
improvements_detailed.reason: Enhances the definition of the low-hanging clouds against the blue gradient without making the image look over-processed

improvements_detailed.action: Crop slightly from the bottom right
improvements_detailed.reason: Tightens the framing to place the subject stronger on the rule of thirds grid and reduces excessive negative space in the foreground

context.subject: Husky dog standing on a sandy beach looking toward the ocean horizon
preserve: The warm golden-hour sunlight hitting the sand and the dog
The smooth blue gradient of the sky

critiques.subject: A dog standing on an empty beach with ocean and expansive sky
improvements: [MODERATE] Crop slightly from the top (reduce empty sky by ~10–20%) and a touch from the right to place the dog closer to a rule-of-thirds intersection while keeping the wide, minimal feel
[SUBTLE] Level the horizon (minor rotation) and apply a gentle vertical transform if needed to keep the seascape lines clean
[MODERATE] Local adjustment on the dog: lift shadows (+20 to +35), add texture/clarity (+10 to +20), and slightly reduce highlights on the sunlit fur (-10 to -20) to retain detail
[SUBTLE] Sky refinement: apply a graduated filter to deepen the upper sky (slightly lower exposure -0.2 to -0.4 and add a bit of dehaze +5 to +10) while keeping cloud highlights protected

[SUBTLE] Global color/tonal tune: warm white balance slightly (+200 to +500K) and add a mild S-curve or contrast in midtones; optionally reduce blue saturation a touch (-5 to -10) if the sky feels too cyan
preserve: The minimalist, wide-open negative space and tranquil shoreline feel
Natural-looking color and soft, late-day lighting
critiques.notes: Strong minimalist beach scene with pleasing light and a clear subject, but the dog is relatively small in the frame and the sky occupies a lot of unused space. A slightly tighter crop, precise horizon leveling, and targeted subject/sky adjustments would increase impact while preserving the calm mood.

improvements_detailed.action: Crop slightly from the top (reduce empty sky by ~10–20%) and a touch from the right to place the dog closer to a rule-of-thirds intersection while keeping the wide, minimal feel
improvements_detailed.reason: The frame is heavily sky-dominant; a tighter crop increases subject presence and improves compositional balance without losing the sense of space.

improvements_detailed.action: Level the horizon (minor rotation) and apply a gentle vertical transform if needed to keep the seascape lines clean
improvements_detailed.reason: A perfectly straight horizon is critical in seascapes and makes the image feel more polished and intentional.

improvements_detailed.action: Local adjustment on the dog: lift shadows (+20 to +35), add texture/clarity (+10 to +20), and slightly reduce highlights on the sunlit fur (-10 to -20) to retain detail
improvements_detailed.reason: Brings out fur detail and separation from the beach while controlling bright areas so the subject reads clearly at a distance.

improvements_detailed.action: Sky refinement: apply a graduated filter to deepen the upper sky (slightly lower exposure -0.2 to -0.4 and add a bit of dehaze +5 to +10) while keeping cloud highlights protected
improvements_detailed.reason: Adds depth and tonal structure to the large sky area, enhancing the overall atmosphere without making it look over-processed.

improvements_detailed.action: Global color/tonal tune: warm white balance slightly (+200 to +500K) and add a mild S-curve or contrast in midtones; optionally reduce blue saturation a touch (-5 to -10) if the sky feels too cyan
improvements_detailed.reason: Balances the cool cast and improves midtone presence, helping the sand and clouds feel more natural and dimensional.

context.subject: A dog standing on an empty beach with ocean and expansive sky
preserve: The minimalist, wide-open negative space and tranquil shoreline feel
Natural-looking color and soft, late-day lighting
